column4: Okay, qtparted is telling me (when I click the sda hdd) .. Error: \SYSTEM~1\_RESTO~1\RP895\CHANGE~1.1 is ok, but it has 4 clusters (16k).
Can I fix this since it is NTFS?
, whats on the disk? vital information?
Well, it is his daughter's computer and it looked like it had quite a bit of stuff on it.. I can use ntfs-3g mount and see/edit the stuff in it .. Just wont boot into MS's OS.
, have you tried to fix mbr with xp bootdisk?

I tried a couple fix things on the disk.. Think it was fixboot fixmbr and rebuild boot.ini .. they all gave errors . I might call him and say "I can save all your daughters stuff, but you are going to have to re-install.
, could be one of the solutions, is the disk label active?
How do you mean disk label? In the live cd it doesn't show up as anything but sda1/ntfs format.
, on the livecd start gparted and take an look at the disks, the one you need most should have an active label...as in bootable
aha .. yeah .. there are two on there .. It is an Compaq box, so I'm assuming the little 5gb spot in the beginning is the compaq rescue partition ..
, if that fails, you could resort to an third party non free "hirensboot cd" wich might help, but i think it boils down to backup all and reinstall
that is odd. The little compaq portion is sda2 but starts at the beginning and the ntfs portion is sda1..
, the ntfs should be the active , does it have an active label?
yeah, they both have active .. the fat32 5gig and the 70 gig ntfs . should I kick the active off the little one?
, give it a try
, what happened before the computer arrived at your place, what was the complain?
will do .. thanks for the ideas .. it's late here and my brain is cooked .. lol ..
heh
ok, good luck
:P
off to play, bye bye
savage!

It had a bad PS. I replaced it and it didn't boot well (long and a few blue screens before it finally gave me these) .. so I tossed a live cd in and looked it over and nothing seemed gone, so I rebooted into the partition table error ..
